quality_assessment: Good - Documentation accurately reflects the implementation with comprehensive coverage of filtering, sorting, and deduplication features

issues.description: Code annotations in YAML blocks (e.g., '# (1)!') are placed incorrectly - they appear inside the code block but are meant to be MkDocs Material annotations which require specific formatting
issues.should_be: Code annotations should be on separate lines after the code block closes, or the annotation syntax should match MkDocs Material requirements
issues.fix_suggestion: Review MkDocs Material code annotation syntax to ensure annotations render properly in the built documentation

issues.description: Documentation mentions 'is_empty' function in the module docstring but it's not explicitly demonstrated in the Filter Functions section
issues.current_content: Filter functions list includes is_null, is_not_null, type checks, string operations, length, and matches
issues.should_be: Consider adding is_empty function example if it exists, or remove reference if not implemented
issues.fix_suggestion: Verify if is_empty function is implemented and add documentation example if so

positive_aspects: Comprehensive coverage of all comparison operators (==, !=, >, <, >=, <=) with both symbolic and word-based alternatives (= for equality)
Excellent documentation of logical operators with both symbol (&&, ||) and word-based (AND, OR) syntax
Clear examples of nested field access (unified_score.final_score, location.coordinates.lat)
Well-documented IN operator with array syntax
Complete coverage of filter functions: is_null, is_not_null, type checks, string operations, length, matches
Proper documentation of sort syntax with ASC/DESC, multiple fields, and nested field support
Accurate documentation of NULLS FIRST/LAST behavior matching the implementation
Clear explanation of deduplication with the distinct field including null handling
Helpful warnings about field non-existence behavior
Accurate source references pointing to actual implementation locations
Good use of MkDocs Material admonitions (warning, tip, note) for important information
improvement_suggestions: Add cross-reference to the pagination.md page since offset/limit are related to work item processing order
Consider adding a 'Processing Order' section explaining the pipeline order: filter → sort → distinct → offset → limit
Add cross-reference to examples.md for more complex filtering scenarios
Consider adding array index access examples (e.g., tags[0]) since the implementation supports this pattern

links_validated.status: No internal links found in document
